summary: The Credit Access and Inclusion Act of 2025 amends the Fair Credit Reporting Act to allow for the reporting of certain full-file consumer credit information to consumer reporting agencies. It permits the reporting of payment information related to lease agreements, utilities, and telecommunications services, with some limitations. Consumers can opt-out of this reporting. The bill also includes provisions regarding payment plans with energy utility firms. Finally, it mandates a GAO study to assess the impact of these changes on consumers and credit scores.
